attributes.action: Stop and/reverse the Data (uses and access) Bill as it is a major breach of GDPR
attributes.additional_details: Because as ordinary citizens ourselves we hold no power as individuals, but more we entrust elected officials to enact our will and policies for us through mass declaration and petitions like these, if that trust isn't acted on then elected officials should be removed from office and new ones elected, which should be happening anyway but the British public has become weak and spineless.. but let's change that, stand up for your privacy and resist this government while we can!
attributes.background: The Data (Uses and Access) Bill being put forward by the UK government breaches our GDPR rights, regardless of the government re-writing the rules, and it must be stopped/reversed otherwise this country no longer has any free speech or freedom of any kind.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Stop the Data (Use and Access) Bill
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/718528
